Hello. I've heard that there were some changes in the HubSpot CMS.
I would like to have your feedback on few points concerning HubSpot.
1/ Is it possible to integrate Bitbucket in HubSpot?
2/ Is it possible to have an auto-deployment in HubSpot (pushing stuff that are deployed automatically into the CMS)
3/ Is it possible to set some limits in the texteditors like avoiding clients to change the font-family or size for exemple. Perfect would be to be able to work with CSS-Classes like a CKEditor would do.

Hey Philippe, I suggest looking into using the command line tooling. You can use any source control you want. Since it is just a CLI utility you can hook into Jenkins or some other CI tool to do the deployment however you’d like. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-local-development|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-local-development>

Hi Philipe, 1 and 2 are answered in the docs below, though we call out GitHub, the same should apply to bitbucket. <http://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow|designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow>

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/github-integration>

Hello!

Some companies are experiencing problems with email delivery in Outlook and Hotmail, with several emails falling into spam without being immediately aware or the user has reported.

Can someone tell me if the emails sent by HubSpot are facing something like that?

For 3, we are actively investigating ways of giving developers more control over the rich text editors.  Stay tuned to our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|developer changelog> to be kept up to date.
Hi everyone, can the annotation “isAvailableForNewContent: true” only used in themes or in themes and templates?
I think in reference to the “annotation” itself I think that is theme specific - however - I know modules have a similar boolean “is_available_for_new_content”
I think with templates if youre hardcoding them it really just comes down to whether or not you slap a flex column in there.

I have a particular client site where the CSS for the template seems to load slower than the rest of the page, resulting in the top nav bar displaying for an initial second without any styling. Then it loads the styling. The template CSS is the first item loading for the page after the layout CSS file. All seems normal and standard setup, but not sure why this is happening. Haven’t seen it before elsewhere. Any thoughts?
is javascript generating class names targetted by the CSS?
